did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Documentary photographer based in Helena, Montana. Collection contains one photograph: "Bedroom, January 2003," an 8x10 selenium-toned black-and-white gelatin silver print on fiber based paper.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is restricted to educational, non-commercial use. All rights are retained by the photographer.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Richard S. Buswell Photographs, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Richard S. Buswell Photographs were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2011.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accession(s) described in this finding aid: 2011-0126

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Richard S. Buswell lives in Helena, Montana where he was born and raised. He photographs the remains of human habitation on the abandoned homesteads, farms, and mines that he comes across while hiking the surrounding countryside. His photographs are part of the permanent collection of many museums, including the Smithsonian, Boston's Museum of Fine Art, the Corcoran, George Eastman House, and the Library of Congress.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: "Bedroom, January 2003" is an 8x10 selenium-toned black-and-white gelatin silver print on fiber based paper.
